name: PALESTINE CHILDRENS RELIEF FUND
mission: We provide free medical care and humanitarian aid for any child in the Middle East, regardless of their religion or politics.
programs:
CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT AND SUSTAINABILITY:
COMMUNITY-CENTERED AND INFRASTRUCTURE ENHANCEMENT
theoryOfChange: PCRF describes providing direct medical care and humanitarian aid to children lacking access to care, deploying international medical teams, sending children abroad for treatment, and rebuilding/establishing pediatric healthcare departments and facilities to bolster the region’s healthcare system.

evaluationSources: Charity Navigator 4-star rating for 12 consecutive years

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.pcrf.net/donate (Source: https://www.pcrf.net/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 40/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: PALESTINE CHILDRENS RELIEF FUND shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.pcrf.net/donate (Source: https://www.pcrf.net/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported a total revenue of $92,196,846 and holds 40.9 months of working capital.
PCRF maintains a program expense ratio of 88.1% and a fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised.
The mission is to provide free medical care and humanitarian aid to children in the Middle East regardless of religion or politics.
The organization distributes flour, delivers clean water, and completes medical missions.
Programs include medical mission treatments, food vouchers, and one-time surgical sponsorships.
The organization provides sponsorship for disabled youth and surgical interventions.
The charity is ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE and provides a policy for zakat-compliant donations.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong score due to its high financial efficiency, significant program transparency, and deep alignment with urgent global health needs in the Middle East.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary relative to some global health interventions.
Operational challenges due to high cause urgency and regional instability.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows high alignment for donors interested in global health and humanitarian aid, maintaining a long track record of neutral service regardless of politics [3][7]. It is highly suited for Muslim donors as a ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE organization that supports vulnerable children through established asnaf categories [10].
dimension_explanations.impact: PCRF demonstrates high financial health with a total revenue of $92,196,846 and a program expense ratio of 88.1% [1][2]. The organization provides direct services including medical missions, clean water delivery, and surgical sponsorships, though the specialized nature of pediatric surgery results in a cost per beneficiary of approximately $7,095 [5][6].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Palestine Children's Relief Fund provides life-saving medical care and humanitarian aid to children across the Middle East regardless of religion or politics.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 88.1%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.02 per $1 raised.
Strong liquidity position with 40.9 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Founded to address the medical needs of youth in the Middle East, the Palestine Children's Relief Fund (PCRF) delivers direct surgical care, infrastructure enhancement, and urgent humanitarian response [3][5]. The organization is recognized as ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through contributions to pediatric healthcare and emergency relief [10].

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid

all_citations.quote: The Palestine Children's Relief Fund was founded in 1991
Our Board of Directors consists of 11 members

all_citations.claim: over 14 million liters of clean water

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong score due to its high financial efficiency, significant program transparency, and deep alignment with urgent global health needs in the Middle East.

areas_for_improvement.context: The charity holds <cite id="1">40.9 months of working capital</cite>, which is considered excessive by standard benchmarks; deploying these funds could accelerate mission delivery.
The average <cite id="2">cost per beneficiary is $7,095.01</cite>, which is higher than many other global health interventions due to the specialized nature of surgical care.

bbb_assessment.summary: The charity has not yet been fully evaluated against all 20 BBB standards.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is currently scaling operations in Gaza to absorb increased funding.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Excessive liquidity (40.9 months)</cite> relative to immediate needs
<cite id="2">High cost per beneficiary ($7,095)</cite> compared to preventative health
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="1">accumulation of nearly 4 years of operating reserves</cite>, which may suggest a bottleneck in fund deployment.

confidence.notes: Very high transparency and recent data availability.

known_gaps: CEO name not explicitly in 990 summary

alignment.explanation: Strong alignment for Muslim donors through <cite id="10">verified zakat programs</cite> serving <cite id="10">masakin in high-urgency zones</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be bolstered by <cite id="5">expanding services to underserved geographies</cite> with even more limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust PCRF due to its <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="4">88.1% independent board governance</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="1">complete a full BBB Wise Giving Alliance accreditation</cite> to meet all 20 standards.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by <cite id="2">88.1% program expense</cite> and direct service delivery, including <cite id="6">1,262 surgical sponsorships</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact could be improved by <cite id="1">publishing a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves</cite> into active programs.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcome tracking and documented theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation of medical missions and aid distribution

rich_narrative.headline: The Palestine Children's Relief Fund provides life-saving medical care and humanitarian aid to children across the Middle East regardless of religion or politics.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide high-impact medical care and emergency relief to Palestinian children through a zakat-eligible, highly efficient institution.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations for the most vulnerable in the Levant
Value organizations that directs 88.1% to programs
Prioritize direct surgical and medical interventions over advocacy
Seek to support long-standing institutions with deep local roots
giving_considerations: The charity is currently holding very high cash reserves
Medical missions are high-cost per individual treated
Operations are subject to extreme regional political instability
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors looking for low-cost preventative health interventions (like vaccines or nets) or those who prefer charities with low cash reserves.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="1">verified outcome metrics</cite> and a <cite id="1">Platinum transparency rating</cite>, though RCTs are not applicable to this surgical model.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: PCRF reduces dependency on outside providers by <cite id="1">training local doctors and building hospital infrastructure</cite> while providing immediate surgical care.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that complex medical missions result in successful long-term health outcomes for pediatric patients.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite high reserves, the <cite id="5">unprecedented humanitarian crisis in Gaza</cite> creates a massive funding gap for reconstruction and long-term care.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Palestine, Gaza, West Bank, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt

peer_comparison.differentiator: PCRF's <cite id="2">100.0% program ratio</cite> exceeds the <cite id="1">peer median of 88.2%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on Syria rather than Palestine
similar_organizations.name: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on vision and nutrition rather than surgery
similar_organizations.name: Helen Keller International

strengths.detail: The organization directs a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 88.1%</cite> toward its mission and maintains a <cite id="1">fundraising cost of only $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>.
In 2024 alone, PCRF delivered <cite id="5">14,657,500 liters of clean water</cite> and completed <cite id="5">23 specialized medical missions</cite>.
Operating since <cite id="3">1991</cite>, the charity has <cite id="1">35 years of experience</cite> navigating complex regional crises.

strengths_deep_dive: PCRF demonstrates a unique ability to scale rapidly during crises, as seen in its <cite id="2">revenue growth from $21.6 million in 2021 to $92.1 million in 2023</cite>. This growth is supported by a <cite id="1">working capital reserve of 48.0 months</cite>, providing extreme financial stability. Their impact is highly tangible, ranging from <cite id="6">1,074 medical mission treatments</cite> to the distribution of <cite id="6">3,600 food vouchers</cite> in a single year.
rich_narrative.summary: The Palestine Children's Relief Fund (PCRF) is a non-political, non-profit organization <cite id="3">founded in 1991</cite> to address the medical and humanitarian needs of children in the Middle East. The organization operates at a significant scale, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $92,196,846</cite> in 2023, representing a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 106.3%</cite>. PCRF's primary mission involves <cite id="5">completing medical missions</cite> and providing <cite id="6">one-time surgical sponsorships</cite> for children who lack access to specialized care locally. Beyond direct medical intervention, the charity has pivoted to meet catastrophic needs in the Gaza Strip, delivering <cite id="5">over 14 million liters of clean water</cite> and <cite id="5">distributing flour</cite> to displaced families. As a <cite id="10">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, PCRF allows Muslim donors to direct their obligatory giving toward the <cite id="10">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> within the Levant region. The organization maintains a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 88.1%</cite> according to its most recent tax filings, ensuring that donor contributions are utilized for direct service delivery. This efficiency is further evidenced by a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised</cite>, which is significantly better than industry averages. PCRF's governance is overseen by an <cite id="4">independent board of 11 members</cite>, and the charity holds a <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of disclosure available.
